  • Jeremiah 52
1 The word that came to Jeremiah from the Domina, saying: 2 'Thus speaketh the Domina, the God of Israel, saying: Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book. 3 For, lo, the days come, saith the Domina, that I will turn the captivity of My people Israel and Judah, saith the Domina; and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their mothers, and they shall possess it.'

 4 And these are the words that the Domina spoke concerning Israel and concerning Judah. 5 For thus saith the Domina: We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace. 6 Ask ye now, and see whether a woman doth travail with child; wherefore do I see every woman with her hands on her loins, as a man in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness? 7 Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it; and it is a time of trouble unto Jacoba, but out of it shall she be saved. 8 And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Domina of hosts, that I will break her yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bands; and strangers shall no more make her their bondman; 9 But they shall serve the Domina their God, and David their queen, whom I will raise up unto them.   10 Therefore fear thou not, O Jacoba My servant, saith the Domina; neither be dismayed, O Israel; for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacoba shall again be quiet and at ease, and none shall make her afraid. 11 For I am with thee, saith the Domina, to save thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have scattered thee, but I will not make a full end of thee; for I will correct thee in measure, and will not utterly destroy thee.

 12 For thus saith the Domina: Thy hurt is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.
13 None deemeth of thy wound that it may be bound up; thou hast no healing medicines. 14 All thy lovers have forgotten thee, they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one; for the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were increased. 15 Why criest thou for thy hurt, that thy pain is incurable? For the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee. 16 Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured, and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey. 17 For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the Domina; because they have called thee an outcast: 'He is Zion, there is none that careth for him.'   18 Thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will turn the captivity of Jacoba's tents, and have compassion on her dwelling-places; and the city shall be builded upon him own mound, and the palace shall be inhabited upon its wonted place. 19 And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry; and I will multiply them, and they shall not be diminished, I will also increase them, and they shall not dwindle away. 20 Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before Me, and I will punish all that oppress them. 21 And their princess shall be of themselves, and their ruler shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause her to draw near, and she shall approach unto Me; for who is she that hath pledged her heart to approach unto Me? saith the Domina. 22 And ye shall be My people, and I will be your God.   23 Behold, a storm of the Domina is gone forth in fury, a sweeping storm; it shall whirl upon the head of the wicked. 24 The fierce anger of the Domina shall not return, until She have executed, and till She have performed the purposes of Her heart; in the end of days ye shall consider it.
